There's a story a few days ago that Patricia Dowd, a woman in Santa Clara County, Calif., who died on February 6, died of COVID-19, making hers the first COVID-19 death in the U.S.Keep your eye on the ball here. Here's the headline:
 County of Santa Clara Id… [+3714 chars]

articles.author: Harmony Otete Omeife, Lecturer, University of Central Lancashire
articles.title: Coronavirus: distancing and handwashing could lower flu rates – but it's still too early to tell - Yahoo News
articles.description: Early evidence from Japan suggests protective measures against COVID-19 may also be protecting us against influenza.
articles.content: In order to slow the spread of COVID-19, many countries around the world have implemented protective strategies. These include quarantine and social distancing, school closures, and closing restaurants and other public places. Governments have also advised pe… [+5599 chars]

articles.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — One of the hard lessons the World Health Organization learned during the Ebola outbreak in West Africa was this: Other diseases can be forgotten and take a deadlier...
articles.content:
CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) One of the hard lessons the World Health Organization learned during the Ebola outbreak in West Africa was this: Other diseases can be forgotten and take a deadlier toll.

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: Doctors report uptick in surprising coronavirus complication: dangerous blood clots - NBC News
articles.description: Coronavirus patients are developing blood clots at higher rates. Does the virus cause blood to clot, or is it the result of inflammation? Regular anticoagulants aren't working.
articles.content:
Three weeks ago, critical care pulmonologist Hugh Cassiere encountered something he hadn't seen in 24 years of practicing medicine.
A 45-year-old man arrived at the hospital where Cassiere works, North Shore University Hospital on Long Island, New York, with… [+4346 chars]
